content.title: Government of Goa State Scholarship to NDA Cadets
content.department: Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Goa
content.beneficiary: Cadets undergoing training at the National Defence Academy (NDA)
content.details: The 'State Scholarship to NDA Cadets' is a scholarship scheme administered by the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Goa. It provides financial assistance to cadets undergoing training at the National Defence Academy (NDA), Khadakwasla, Pune.
benefits: Monthly scholarship of ₹1,000 during training period at NDA
eligibility: Cadet's parents/guardians' monthly income should not exceed ₹15,000 (₹1,80,000 per annum); for SC/ST/OBC categories, the limit is ₹37,500 per month (₹4,50,000 per annum)
Cadet should either have been born in Goa or domiciled in Goa for at least 15 years
exclusions: Applicants should not be receiving financial assistance, scholarships, or freeships from any other source
content.application_process: Applicants should submit their duly filled and signed scholarship applications, along with the required documents, to the concerned authority at the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Goa, located at DTE Building, Alto-Porvorim, Bardez, Goa 403521.
documents_required: Required documents as specified by the Directorate of Higher Education

faqs.question: What is the main objective of this scholarship scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective of the 'State Scholarship to NDA Cadets' is to offer financial support to underprivileged cadets from Goa who have chosen to serve the nation by joining the Defence Services.

faqs.question: Can a cadet who has applied for the scholarship in the past but was not selected reapply in subsequent years?
faqs.answer: If a cadet applied in the past but was not selected, they can typically reapply in subsequent years as long as they continue to meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: If a cadet is from a different state but has been domiciled in Goa for 15 years, are they eligible for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as a cadet has been domiciled in Goa for a continuous period of at least 15 years, they are eligible for the scholarship, even if they were born in a different state.
